what: Colour Palettes of Neotropical Poison Frogs
title: Colour Palettes of Neotropical Poison Frogs
text: poisonfrogs extensive collection colour palettes inspired species morphs Neotropical poison frogs. …

title: Colour Palettes of Neotropical Poison Frogs
text: can install development version poisonfrogs GitHub :

title: Colour Palettes of Neotropical Poison Frogs
text: make nice examples .  ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . can also embed plots, example: case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: require(tidyverse)  example_data <- tibble(   group = factor(rep(c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E"), each = 50)),   value = c(     rnorm(50, mean = 800, sd = 160), # group A     rnorm(50, mean = 600, sd = 90), # group B     rnorm(50, mean = 500, sd = 80), # group C     rnorm(50, mean = 300, sd = 80), # group D     rnorm(50, mean = 270, sd = 80) # group E   ) ) #discrete scale ggplot(example_data, aes(group, value, fill = group)) +   geom_boxplot(alpha = 0.9) +   theme_classic(base_size = 32, base_line_size = 0.5) +   scale_fill_poison(     "ranitomeya3",     type = "discrete",     alpha = 0.95,     direction = -1   )

what: Get colours from a poison frog palette — poison_palette
title: Get colours from a poison frog palette — poison_palette
text: Generator discrete continuous palettes

title: Get colours from a poison frog palette — poison_palette
code: poison_palette(   name,   n = NULL,   type = c("discrete", "continuous"),   direction = 1,   alpha = NULL )

title: Get colours from a poison frog palette — poison_palette
text: name Character. Palette name (see poison_palettes_names()). n Integer (optional). Number colours return. Defaults palette length type = "discrete" 256 type = "continuous". type Either "discrete" "continuous". direction Integer. 1 forward, -1 reversed order. alpha Optional numeric [0, 1]. Uniform transparency applied colours.

title: Get colours from a poison frog palette — poison_palette
text: Character vector hex colours (alpha applied requested).

text: Poison frog palettes

what: Colour Palettes of Neotropical Poison Frogs — poisonfrogs
title: Colour Palettes of Neotropical Poison Frogs — poisonfrogs
text: Provides colour palettes inspired enormous diversity skin colours Neotropical poison frog species. Suitable use ggplot2 base R graphics.

title: Colour Palettes of Neotropical Poison Frogs — poisonfrogs
text: Maintainer: Camilo Rodríguez camilorl@stanford.edu Authors: Lauren O'Connell loconnel@stanford.edu

what: Poison frog colour scale for ggplot2 — scale_colour_poison
title: Poison frog colour scale for ggplot2 — scale_colour_poison
text: unified colour scale works either discrete continuous data, controlled type. discrete data uses ggplot2::discrete_scale(), continuous data builds smooth gradient ggplot2::scale_colour_gradientn().

title: Poison frog colour scale for ggplot2 — scale_colour_poison
code: scale_colour_poison(   name,   type = c("discrete", "continuous"),   direction = 1,   alpha = NULL,   ... )  scale_color_poison(   name,   type = c("discrete", "continuous"),   direction = 1,   alpha = NULL,   ... )

title: Poison frog colour scale for ggplot2 — scale_colour_poison
text: name Character. Name poison-frog palette use (must exist internal poison_palettes registry). type Either "discrete" "continuous". Selects kind ggplot2 scale constructed. direction Integer. 1 palette stored order, -1 reverse . alpha Optional numeric [0, 1]. supplied, applies uniform transparency colours (discrete continuous modes). ... Additional arguments passed underlying ggplot2 scale (e.g. limits, breaks, labels, guide, oob, etc.).

title: Poison frog colour scale for ggplot2 — scale_colour_poison
text: ggplot2 scale object.

title: Poison frog colour scale for ggplot2 — scale_colour_poison
text: Discrete: relies internal function factory poison_pal() returns n colours demand ggplot2::discrete_scale(). Continuous: generates 256-colour gradient via poison_palette() (type "continuous") passes ggplot2::scale_colour_gradientn().

title: Poison frog colour scale for ggplot2 — scale_colour_poison
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(ggplot2)  # Discrete example ggplot(mtcars, aes(factor(cyl), fill = factor(gear))) +   geom_bar() +   scale_fill_poison("O_sylvatica_N", type = "discrete")  # Continuous example ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg, colour = disp)) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_colour_poison("D_tinctorius", type = "continuous", direction = -1) } # }

what: Poison frog fill scale for ggplot2 — scale_fill_poison
title: Poison frog fill scale for ggplot2 — scale_fill_poison
text: unified fill scale works either discrete continuous data, controlled type. discrete data uses ggplot2::discrete_scale(), continuous data builds smooth gradient ggplot2::scale_fill_gradientn().

title: Poison frog fill scale for ggplot2 — scale_fill_poison
code: scale_fill_poison(   name,   type = c("discrete", "continuous"),   direction = 1,   alpha = NULL,   ... )

title: Poison frog fill scale for ggplot2 — scale_fill_poison
text: name Character. Name poison-frog palette use (must exist internal poison_palettes registry). type Either "discrete" "continuous". Selects kind ggplot2 scale constructed. direction Integer. 1 palette stored order, -1 reverse . alpha Optional numeric [0, 1]. supplied, applies uniform transparency colours (discrete continuous modes). ... Additional arguments passed underlying ggplot2 scale (e.g. limits, breaks, labels, guide, oob, etc.).

title: Poison frog fill scale for ggplot2 — scale_fill_poison
text: ggplot2 scale object.

title: Poison frog fill scale for ggplot2 — scale_fill_poison
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(ggplot2)  # Discrete example ggplot(mpg, aes(class, fill = drv)) +   geom_bar() +   scale_fill_poison("O_sylvatica_S", type = "discrete", alpha = 0.95)  # Continuous example ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy, fill = cty)) +   geom_point(shape = 21, size = 3, colour = "white") +   scale_fill_poison("D_tinctorius", type = "continuous") } # }

what: Show a poison frog palette as coloured tiles — show_poison
title: Show a poison frog palette as coloured tiles — show_poison
text: Show poison frog palette coloured tiles

title: Show a poison frog palette as coloured tiles — show_poison
code: show_poison(   name,   n = NULL,   type = c("discrete", "continuous"),   direction = 1,   alpha = NULL )

title: Show a poison frog palette as coloured tiles — show_poison
text: name Palette name (see poison_palettes_names()). n Number colours show (defaults full length discrete, 16 continuous). type "discrete" "continuous". direction 1 forward, -1 reversed. alpha Optional transparency 0, 1.

title: Show a poison frog palette as coloured tiles — show_poison
text: ggplot2 object (plot palette).
